Owen's Spanish Morning

A1

ES: Owen se despierta. Es una mañana soleada. "¡Hola, Owen!" dice Plock. Plock es un robot amigo.

EN: Owen wakes up. It is a sunny morning. "Hello, Owen!" says Plock. Plock is a robot friend.

ES: Plock tiene una idea. "Vamos a aprender español hoy," dice Plock. Owen está muy feliz. "¡Sí, vamos!"

EN: Plock has an idea. "Let's learn Spanish today," says Plock. Owen is very happy. "Yes, let's go!"

ES: Primero, ven los colores. "Mira, Owen," dice Plock. "Tu cama es azul. La pelota es roja."

EN: First, they see colors. "Look, Owen," says Plock. "Your bed is blue. The ball is red."

ES: Owen mira la ventana. "El cielo es azul," dice Owen. "Las flores son rojas. ¡Aprendo mucho!"

EN: Owen looks at the window. "The sky is blue," says Owen. "The flowers are red. I learn a lot!"

ES: Después, van a la cocina. "Comemos fruta aquí," dice Plock. "La manzana es roja. La banana es amarilla."

EN: Next, they go to the kitchen. "We eat fruit here," says Plock. "The apple is red. The banana is yellow."

ES: Owen come una manzana. "¡Qué rico!" dice. "Me gusta la fruta." Plock sonríe.

EN: Owen eats an apple. "How delicious!" he says. "I like fruit." Plock smiles.

ES: "Ahora, la familia," dice Plock. "Tu mamá es simpática. Tu papá es alto." Owen asiente.

EN: "Now, family," says Plock. "Your mom is nice. Your dad is tall." Owen nods.

ES: Owen está contento. "¡El español es divertido!" dice. "Gracias, Plock, mi amigo." Plock está feliz también.

EN: Owen is happy. "Spanish is fun!" he says. "Thank you, Plock, my friend." Plock is happy too.

Vocabulary

hola - hello
mañana - morning
robot - robot
aprender - to learn
azul - blue
rojo - red
ventana - window
cocina - kitchen
manzana - apple
familia - family
amigo - friend
feliz - happy

Grammar Note

In this story, we use the verb "ser" (to be) to describe what things are. For example, "Plock es un robot" means "Plock is a robot." We also see how adjectives (descriptive words) match the noun they describe in gender, like "La pelota es roja" (The ball is red) where 'roja' ends in -a because 'pelota' is feminine, and "Tu cama es azul" (Your bed is blue) where 'azul' works for both masculine and feminine nouns.
